meanings.definition: The fused head and thorax of an arachnid.
meanings.sent1: The cephalthoraces of the spider help it to move and hunt for food.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the cephalthoraces of the scorpion under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The spider wore a tiny hat on its cephalthoraces, looking quite fashionable.
meanings.sent4: The scorpion's cephalthoraces were like a sturdy shield protecting its body.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the cephalthoraces of the arachnid fascinated the biology students.

meanings.definition: The anterior part of a crustacean's body, consisting of the head and thorax combined.
meanings.sent1: The lobster's cephalthoraces contain its vital organs and sensory appendages.
meanings.sent2: The crab's cephalthoraces are covered by a hard exoskeleton for protection.
meanings.sent3: The shrimp decided to throw a party in its cephalthoraces, inviting all its crustacean friends.
meanings.sent4: The hermit crab's cephalthoraces served as its cozy home, moving from one shell to another.
meanings.sent5: The crayfish's cephalthoraces shimmered in the sunlight, reflecting its colorful surroundings.
